verses.verse: Then he brought <S%H3318><s%> me out into the outer <S%H2435><s%> court, <S%H2691><s%> the way <S%H1870><s%> toward <S%H1870><s%> the north; <S%H6828><s%> and he brought <S%H935><s%> me to the chamber <S%H3957><s%> which <S%H834><s%> [was] opposite <S%H5048><s%> the separate <S%H1508><s%> area <S%H1508><s%> and opposite <S%H5048><s%> the building <S%H1146><s%> toward <S%H413><s%> the north. <S%H6828><s%>

Along <S%H413><s%> <S%H6440><s%> the length, <S%H753><s%> [which was] a hundred <S%H3967><s%> cubits, <S%H520><s%> [was] the north <S%H6828><s%> door; <S%H6607><s%> the width <S%H7341><s%> [was] fifty <S%H2572><s%> cubits. <S%H520><s%>

Opposite <S%H5048><s%> the twenty <S%H6242><s%> [cubits] which <S%H834><s%> belonged to the inner <S%H6442><s%> court, <S%H2691><s%> and opposite <S%H5048><s%> the pavement <S%H7531><s%> which <S%H834><s%> belonged to the outer <S%H2435><s%> court, <S%H2691><s%> [was] gallery <S%H9042><s%> corresponding <S%H413><s%> <S%H6440><s%> to gallery <S%H9042><s%> in three <S%H7992><s%> stories.

And before <S%H6440><s%> the chambers <S%H3957><s%> [was] an inner <S%H6442><s%> walk <S%H4109><s%> ten <S%H6235><s%> cubits <S%H520><s%> wide, <S%H7341><s%> a way <S%H1870><s%> of one <S%H259><s%> [hundred] cubits; <S%H520><s%> and their openings <S%H6607><s%> [were] on the north. <S%H6828><s%>

Now the upper <S%H5945><s%> chambers <S%H3957><s%> [were] smaller <S%H9527><s%> because <S%H3588><s%> the galleries <S%H9042><s%> took <S%H398><s%> more <S%H4480><s%> [space] away <S%H398><s%> from them than <S%H4480><s%> from the lower <S%H8481><s%> and middle <S%H8484><s%> ones <S%H8484><s%> in the building. <S%H1146><s%>

For they [were] in three <S%H8027><s%> stories and had <S%H369><s%> no <S%H369><s%> pillars <S%H5982><s%> like the pillars <S%H5982><s%> of the courts; <S%H2691><s%> therefore <S%H5921><s%> <S%H3651><s%> [the upper chambers] were set <S%H680><s%> back <S%H680><s%> from the ground <S%H776><s%> upward, more <S%H4480><s%> than <S%H4480><s%> the lower <S%H8481><s%> and middle <S%H8484><s%> ones. <S%H8484><s%>

As for the outer <S%H2351><s%> wall <S%H1447><s%> by the side <S%H5980><s%> of the chambers, <S%H3957><s%> toward <S%H1870><s%> the outer <S%H2435><s%> court <S%H2691><s%> facing <S%H6440><s%> the chambers, <S%H3957><s%> its length <S%H753><s%> [was] fifty <S%H2572><s%> cubits. <S%H520><s%>

For the length <S%H753><s%> of the chambers <S%H3957><s%> which <S%H834><s%> [were] in the outer <S%H2435><s%> court <S%H2691><s%> [was] fifty <S%H2572><s%> cubits; <S%H520><s%> and behold, <S%H2009><s%> [the length of those] facing <S%H6440><s%> the temple <S%H1964><s%> [was] a hundred <S%H3967><s%> cubits. <S%H520><s%>

And below <S%H4480><s%> <S%H8478><s%> these <S%H428><s%> chambers <S%H3957><s%> [was] the entrance <S%H3996><s%> on the east <S%H6921><s%> side, <S%H6921><s%> as one enters <S%H935><s%> them from the outer <S%H2435><s%> court. <S%H2691><s%>

In the thickness <S%H7341><s%> of the wall <S%H1447><s%> of the court <S%H2691><s%> toward <S%H1870><s%> the east, <S%H6921><s%> facing <S%H413><s%> <S%H6440><s%> the separate <S%H1508><s%> area <S%H1508><s%> and facing <S%H413><s%> <S%H6440><s%> the building, <S%H1146><s%> [there were] chambers. <S%H3957><s%>

And the way <S%H1870><s%> in front <S%H6440><s%> of them [was] like the appearance <S%H4758><s%> of the chambers <S%H3957><s%> which <S%H834><s%> [were] on the north, <S%H6828><s%> according to their length <S%H753><s%> so <S%H3651><s%> was their width; <S%H7341><s%> and all <S%H3605><s%> their exits <S%H4161><s%> [were] both according to their arrangements <S%H4941><s%> and openings. <S%H6607><s%>

And corresponding to the openings <S%H6607><s%> of the chambers <S%H3957><s%> which <S%H834><s%> were toward <S%H1870><s%> the south <S%H1864><s%> was an opening <S%H6607><s%> at the head <S%H7218><s%> of the way, <S%H1870><s%> the way <S%H1870><s%> in front <S%H6440><s%> of the wall <S%H1448><s%> toward <S%H1870><s%> the east, <S%H6921><s%> as one enters <S%H935><s%> them.

Then he said <S%H559><s%> to me, "The north <S%H6828><s%> chambers <S%H3957><s%> [and] the south <S%H1864><s%> chambers, <S%H3957><s%> which <S%H834><s%> are opposite <S%H413><s%> <S%H6440><s%> the separate <S%H1508><s%> area, <S%H1508><s%> they are the holy <S%H6944><s%> chambers <S%H3957><s%> where <S%H834><s%> <S%H8033><s%> the priests <S%H3548><s%> who <S%H834><s%> are near <S%H7138><s%> to the Lord <S%H3068><s%> shall eat <S%H398><s%> the most <S%H6944><s%> holy <S%H6944><s%> things. <S%H6944><s%> There <S%H8033><s%> they shall lay <S%H5117><s%> the most <S%H6944><s%> holy <S%H6944><s%> things, <S%H6944><s%> the grain offering, <S%H4503><s%> the sin <S%H9128><s%> offering, <S%H9128><s%> and the guilt <S%H817><s%> offering; <S%H817><s%> for the place <S%H4725><s%> is holy. <S%H6918><s%>

"When the priests <S%H3548><s%> enter, <S%H935><s%> then they shall not go <S%H3318><s%> out into the outer <S%H2435><s%> court <S%H2691><s%> from the sanctuary <S%H6944><s%> without laying <S%H5117><s%> there <S%H8033><s%> their garments <S%H899><s%> in which <S%H834><s%> they minister, <S%H8334><s%> for they are holy. <S%H6944><s%> They shall put <S%H3847><s%> on other <S%H312><s%> garments; <S%H899><s%> then they shall approach <S%H7126><s%> that which <S%H834><s%> is for the people. <S%H5971><s%>"

Now when he had finished <S%H3615><s%> measuring <S%H4060><s%> the inner <S%H6442><s%> house, <S%H1004><s%> he brought <S%H3318><s%> me out by the way <S%H1870><s%> of the gate <S%H8179><s%> which <S%H834><s%> faced <S%H6440><s%> toward <S%H1870><s%> the east, <S%H6921><s%> and measured <S%H4058><s%> it all <S%H5439><s%> around. <S%H5439><s%>

He measured <S%H4058><s%> on the east <S%H6921><s%> side <S%H7307><s%> with the measuring <S%H4060><s%> reed <S%H7070><s%> five <S%H2568><s%> hundred <S%H3967><s%> reeds, <S%H7070><s%> by the measuring <S%H4060><s%> reed. <S%H7070><s%>
He measured <S%H4058><s%> on the north <S%H6828><s%> side <S%H7307><s%> five <S%H2568><s%> hundred <S%H3967><s%> reeds <S%H7070><s%> by the measuring <S%H4060><s%> reed. <S%H7070><s%>
On the south <S%H1864><s%> side <S%H7307><s%> he measured <S%H4058><s%> five <S%H2568><s%> hundred <S%H3967><s%> reeds <S%H7070><s%> with the measuring <S%H4060><s%> reed. <S%H7070><s%>

He turned <S%H5437><s%> to the west <S%H3220><s%> side, <S%H7307><s%> [and] measured <S%H4058><s%> five <S%H2568><s%> hundred <S%H3967><s%> reeds <S%H7070><s%> with the measuring <S%H4060><s%> reed. <S%H7070><s%>

He measured <S%H4058><s%> it on the four <S%H702><s%> sides; <S%H7307><s%> it had a wall <S%H2346><s%> all <S%H5439><s%> around, <S%H5439><s%> the length <S%H753><s%> five <S%H2568><s%> hundred <S%H3967><s%> and the width <S%H7341><s%> five <S%H2568><s%> hundred, <S%H3967><s%> to divide <S%H914><s%> between <S%H996><s%> the holy <S%H6944><s%> and the profane. <S%H2455><s%>
